Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>の話ですか…… ええ、言い伝えなら知っていますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You want to know about the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>? Well, I do know of such a legend.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当ですか？ ぜひ、 おうかがいしたいのですが……
Entry.EnglishText: You do? If you wouldn't mind, we'd like to hear it.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……太古の昔、邪悪なる王と戦い、 世界を守った聖者が、傷をいやすために この地で眠りについたと言われています。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Long ago, several Saints defended this world from a wicked King. Legend states that one of them slumbers in these lands so that her wounds may be healed.
Entry.Notes: is it a single Saint or multiple Saints?

Entry.JapaneseText: 我が部族は、いつかその聖者が よみがえる日のために、 あの<Cyan>聖壇<White>を守り続けているのです。
Entry.EnglishText: Our tribe diligently protects the <Cyan>sacred altar<White> in anticipation for the day that the Saint will be revived.

Entry.JapaneseText: それが<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>なのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Is that Saint the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: 「<Cyan>聖壇<White>に、<Yellow>命の珠<White>の赤く燃ゆる時、 <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>は羽ばたかん」 ……そう伝えられています。
Entry.EnglishText: " When the <Yellow>Jewel of Life<White> glows red atop the <Cyan>sacred altar<White>, the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> shall spread her wings once more." ...Or so they say.
Entry.Notes: stop changing this line until we have fixed the kerning of the quotation mark and the capital W, it needs that space. Dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>命の珠<White>というのは？
Entry.EnglishText: What is this <Yellow>Jewel of Life<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: さあ、私にもそこまでは……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry, but that's all I know.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうですか……
Entry.EnglishText: I see.

Entry.JapaneseText: すみませんな、ヒューマとは かかわりたくないのですじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Pardon me, but I don't want anything to do with a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「<Cyan>聖壇<White>に、<Yellow>命の珠<White>の赤く燃ゆる時、 <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>は羽ばたかん」 ……そう伝えられています。
Entry.EnglishText: " When the <Yellow>Jewel of Life<White> glows red atop the <Cyan>sacred altar<White>, the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> shall spread her wings once more." ...Or so they say.
Entry.Notes: stop changing this line until we have fixed the kerning of the quotation mark and the capital W, it needs that space. Dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: ですが、<Yellow>命の珠<White>が何なのか、 それは私にもわかりません……
Entry.EnglishText: But what could this <Yellow>Jewel of Life<White> possibly be? Even I haven't the slightest clue...

Entry.JapaneseText: すみませんな、ヒューマとは かかわりたくないのですじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Pardon me, but I don't want anything to do with a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ドバル様が階級をお作りになられたのは、 <Red>劣等民<White>のヒューマどもに対抗するため……
Entry.EnglishText: Chief Doval devised the class system to combat those <Red>Inferior Citizens<White>, the Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 我らには今、厳しい規律と、 団結が必要とされておるんですよ……
Entry.EnglishText: As such, we require strict order and unity at this very moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの子たちは、 ツルベナ荒野の地上絵や <Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>の話を聞きに来ました。
Entry.EnglishText: Those children came here earlier to ask about the geoglyph in the Crvena Wasteland and the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんでも、<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>に お願いしたい事があるとか……
Entry.EnglishText: They must have something they wish to request of the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 子らの願いを<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>は 聞き届けてくれるでしょうか。
Entry.EnglishText: But will the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White> hear them out?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマ同士で争う…… 確かに、誉められたことでは ないのかもしれん。
Entry.EnglishText: Seeing fellow Gajuma quarreling with one another... This is indeed a situation I cannot commend.

Entry.JapaneseText: すみませんな、ヒューマとは かかわりたくないのですじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Pardon me, but I don't want anything to do with a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……今はまだ、ヒューマと 話す気になれんのですじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I'm still not interested in speaking with a Huma just yet.

Entry.JapaneseText: 妙な音が鳴っておりますが、 この歳になると、もう怖いモノは ありませんわい。
Entry.EnglishText: This sound is rather strange, but you'll learn to fear nothing when you're as old as me.
Entry.Notes: it's the sound that appears later in the story (Razilda sinking)

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたもずいぶん、どっしりと 構えてらっしゃいますの？
Entry.EnglishText: You've also built up quite the sturdy body, haven't you?

Entry.JapaneseText: この妙な音なんかより、 ヒューマとかかわる事のほうが よっぽどわずらわしいですじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd rather deal with a Huma than get involved with whatever is making that strange sound...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてヒトは、 ガジュマとヒューマに分かれて 生まれてきたのかの……
Entry.EnglishText: Why do you think that mankind was divided into Gajuma and Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: すみませんな、ヒューマとは かかわりたくないのですじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Pardon me, but I don't want anything to do with a Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: もしかしたら、種族の違いとは、 ただの思い込みだったのかも 知れませんな……
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps the differences between our species was just an idea we came up with...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当にガジュマとヒューマが 違うものであったなら 助け合おうと考えることすら なかったじゃろう。
Entry.EnglishText: If Gajuma and Huma truly were different, we would not even have considered helping one another.

Entry.JapaneseText: お元気ですかいの。
Entry.EnglishText: Are you doing well?

Entry.JapaneseText: 我らガジュマは体が資本。 大事にしなされ。
Entry.EnglishText: For us Gajuma, our very bodies are our assets. Make sure to take good care of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマ……ううむ、どうにも 理解できん存在ですじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: As for the Huma... Hmm... I just can't wrap my head around their existence.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『イースタリアウチワサボテンの鉢』 おじいさんにとって 他のサボテンとは一線を画す存在。 一際愛着をもって接している。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Potted Eastalia Fan Cactus - For the old man here, this cactus is special compared to all the other cacti. He seems very fond of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『かまど』 土を練り上げて作られている。 この街の主食ナンを焼くための 適度な火力を得られる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Clay Stove - This stove was produced using refined clay. It generates a moderate heat to bake naan, the staple food of Pipista.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『サボテンの鉢棚』 おじいさんが趣味で集めている。 カレギアには１０８種類のサボテンが あると言われており、全種類を集める 事が、おじいさんの夢、そして青春。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cacti Shelf - The old man here collects cacti as a hobby. It is said there are 108 different species of Cacti in Callegea. Collecting all these species has been his dream since his days as a youth.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『サボテンの鉢棚』 おじいさんが趣味で集めている。 全部違う種類のサボテンで、 隣の部屋のもあわせると 現在、２６種類が並んでいる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cacti Shelf - The old man here collects cacti as a hobby. Each cactus here is a different species, including the one in the room over. He currently holds 26 different species.
